summary: This is an email from Robert W. Nagle, the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator for the Federal Bureau of Prisons, to Warden NI'Diaye at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It schedules and outlines the materials required for a psychological reconstruction following the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The document reveals the formal BOP process initiated immediately after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Robert W. Nagle
persons.role: National Suicide Prevention Coordinator, Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: Author of the email scheduling the psychological reconstruction of inmate Epstein's death and requesting materials and staff assistance from the warden.

persons.name: Warden NI'Diaye
persons.context: Recipient of the email, responsible for supporting the scheduling of the psychological reconstruction and gathering required materials at the correctional institution.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death is the subject of the scheduled psychological reconstruction by the Bureau of Prisons.

connections.description: Nagle, as the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator, is corresponding with Warden NI'Diaye to coordinate the official psychological reconstruction process following an inmate's death.
Nagle is leading the team responsible for reconstructing the circumstances of Epstein's death for the Bureau of Prisons.
NI'Diaye was the warden of the facility where Epstein was incarcerated and died, making him responsible for the institution's records and staff related to the incident.

events.title: Scheduling of Psychological Reconstruction
events.description: Robert Nagle emails Warden NI'Diaye to schedule and outline the requirements for a psychological reconstruction of inmate Epstein's death, with work planned for the following Tuesday through Thursday.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (implied institution)
keyFacts: The Federal Bureau of Prisons initiated a formal 'Psychological Reconstruction' of Jeffrey Epstein's death immediately after it occurred in August 2019.
The reconstruction process required an extensive list of materials including video footage, staff memoranda, inmate records, autopsy reports, and evidence logs.
The reconstruction team was scheduled to stay at the Sheraton Tribeca and required an assigned staff member from the institution to facilitate interviews and document collection.
The document lists standard BOP suicide investigation procedures, indicating the death was being treated as a suicide for official review purposes.
